page.title: 11Ecology(1) in Leverton
page.content: Although the land is intensively farmed there are several areas of mature trees and hedges,some open grassland and the outmarsh which are havens for wildlife.The drainage dykes are usually heavily polluted by fertilizer and pesticides and do not contain much wildlife beyond rats and water voles.Mammals are represented by foxes,stoats and weasels,rabbits and hares,grey squirrels,shrews,mice and the ubiquitous rat.The grey squirrels are confined to one small area and have only arrived in the district within the last three years and there are now at least half a dozen.Foxes and hares are fairly intensively shot but tend still to survive in fair numbers.Rabbits are no longer as common as they used to be because of myxamatosis which is still present in the area.
